sentence.Network_en: He liked to shock with his gold chains and loud clothes.
sentence.Network_cn: 他喜欢戴金链子，穿花里胡哨的衣服来招人反感。

sentence.Network_en: The chains were at different heights on the wall.
sentence.Network_cn: 挂在墙上的链子高低不齐。
超市连锁店已经稍稍降价。

entry.def: A chain consists of metal rings connected together in a line.

example.ex: His open shirt revealed a fat gold chain...
example.tran: 他的衬衫敞着，露出一条很粗的金链。

example.ex: The dogs were leaping and growling at the full stretch of their chains.
example.tran: 那些狗又蹦又叫，把链子绷得紧紧的。

entry.def: If prisoners are in chains, they have thick rings of metal round their wrists or ankles to prevent them from escaping.

example.ex: He'd spent four and a half years in windowless cells, much of the time in chains.
example.tran: 他已经在没有窗户的牢房里呆了4年半，多数时间都戴着镣铐。

entry.def: You can refer to feelings and duties which prevent you from doing what you want to do as chains .

example.ex: He had to break right now the chains of habit that bound him to the present.
example.tran: 他必须现在就打破把他束缚在当前境况的习惯。

entry.def: If a person or thing is chained to something, they are fastened to it with a chain.

example.ex: The dog was chained to the leg of the one solid garden seat...
example.tran: 狗被拴在公园一个固定座位的腿上。

example.ex: She chained her bike to the railings...
example.tran: 她把自行车锁在栏杆上。

entry.def: A chain of things is a group of them existing or arranged in a line.

example.ex: ...a chain of islands known as the Windward Islands...
Students tried to form a human chain around the parliament.
example.tran: 学生们试图在议会四周围成人墙。

entry.def: A chain of shops, hotels, or other businesses is a number of them owned by the same person or company.

example.tran: 意大利最大的连锁影院

entry.def: A chain of events is a series of them happening one after another.

example.ex: ...the bizarre chain of events that led to his departure in January 1938.
example.tran: 促使他于1938年1月离去的一连串离奇事件

means.word_mean: 1. metal shackles; for hands or legs

Sentence.sentence: Iced coffees sold by some popular chains are contaminated.

The World Cancer Research Fund (WCRF) conducted a survey of iced coffees sold by some popular chains in Britain including Starbucks, Caffe Nero and Costa Coffee to gauge the calories as studies increasingly link obesity with cancer
